Fields.DialogueText: What's this? Scrap metal? Is the ship damaged?
Oh! Bonjour, Capitaine. I see you've found part of my collection.
Collection? You collect scrap metal?
That's not just a random piece of metal. It's from one of the Morganas.

Fields.MenuText: You're collecting Morgana remains? Are they your trophies?
I assume that you have a reason for this?
I’m not too fond of having anything Morgana-related on the ship. Memorabilia or not, it's bad luck.

Fields.DialogueText: Non, I don’t collect them for sport, Capitaine. They're meant for understanding the enemy.
Of course I do. Research.
I'm not going to throw them overboard, Capitaine. This scrap is crucial to the war effort. Even one piece could lead to a breakthrough.
What do you hope to learn from your collection?
Anything. How the Morganas operate, their weaponry, weaknesses, strengths...
You believe that you could gain information that vital from minuscule bits of scrap?
I do. You'd be surprised what you can learn from something this small. All it takes is a good eye.
Just try not to misplace anything, all right?
Of course, Capitaine!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Je suis là, Capitaine.
Glad to hear it.
Enemy approaching. We may be able to add to your Morgana debris collection in a few minutes...
@BATTLE
A well-fought battle, Captain. I'm glad that we made it out safely.
I am too. Hey... are we short someone? Who isn't eating today?
Émile, maybe? Last I saw, she went to her quarters with a stack of stationery in hand...

Fields.MenuText: Have any idea why?
I hope Émile isn't working herself too hard. We all need some rest from time to time...
Belles don’t actually need to eat, do they?

Fields.DialogueText: Not sure. I assumed you would know...
If she keeps this up, someone will need to check on her eventually. We can’t have our Belle failing to take care of herself.
I think it depends on the Belle.
You also mentioned something about stationery?
That's right, Captain. A whole stack of paper. She was carrying a pencil, too. Maybe she has some sort of hobby?
Could be.
You know, now that I think about it... I think she was actually headed toward your quarters...
Hmm...
Émile? Are you around?
I'm in your quarters, Capitaine.
What are you doing? You’ve become somewhat scarce recently.
Well... I was working on some new blueprints.
Blueprints? I wasn’t aware that was an interest of yours. What designs are you working on?
Ship specifications, weaponry, interior layout... most of the fleet’s ships are flawed, I'm sorry to say. In one way or another.
Flawed?
Oui. I believe that with some of the ideas that I have, the ships could become more efficient and durable. We have to adapt to the threat at hand.

Fields.MenuText: You're quite the critic. Have you always been this way?
Mind if I take a look at them sometime? Maybe I could offer some insight.
I appreciate your drive, Émile. But don't overdo it. I don't want you crashing and burning in the middle of a fight.

Fields.DialogueText: I just want everyone to do better. Think of how quickly this conflict would have ended if our ships were in better shape.
Really? You'd be interested in doing that? I'd be honored.
I only skipped a meal or two to work on this...  but I'll take what you said into consideration.
*ALARM*
Let’s get to it.
Oui, Capitaine!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Je suis là, Capitaine.
I should think so. You wouldn't want to miss out on the excitement!
Is that sarcasm?
No. Too much adrenaline in my system for sarcasm right now.
@BATTLE
That's the last of them, Captain. No Morganas in sight.
Great work, everyone. Let's keep up the momentum.
We really turned the "tide" on that battle.
Excuse me?
It was a joke. Tide... we’re in the ocean... so...
Um...
Just thought I'd try to lighten the mood. I'm guessing you're not the type to crack jokes?

Fields.MenuText: I like jokes. I’d just rather they make sense.
I'm just giving you a hard time, Émile.
I’m afraid not, Émile. I have too many serious subjects on my mind.

Fields.DialogueText: Okay. I think I get it now... I'll try harder next time, Capitaine. I apologize.
Still, you didn’t laugh.
Oh... that’s a shame.
I'll get you to laugh one day!
What's that noise? It sounds like chewing... do you hear that, Émile?
Did you... oh! It's coming from you. Are you chewing your pencil?
Oui... sorry to distract you, Capitaine! I was just thinking about possible ship designs...
Is that a compulsion of yours? I know some of the crew members on board chew their fingernails.
A bit of one, I suppose. It helps me think. My thoughts get blocked up if I don't do it.

Fields.MenuText: Just try not to lose focus when the crew needs you, okay?
Do you want some help? I can fix that bad habit of yours if you'd like.
I'm not going to even question it. If it works for you, then I’m happy.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry about me, Capitaine. I’d never be so careless.
No... I don't want it “fixed.” I appreciate your offer, though.
I'm glad! Some people get quite annoyed by it.
*ALARM*
Are you going to continue chewing on that pencil during battle?
Don’t be silly, Capitaine.
@BATTLE
Quite difficult, n'est-ce pas?
What?
The war, our enemy, staying cool under all this pressure... a real challenge!
You seem to enjoy it.
I don't like all the fighting, or the fact that the Morganas could wipe out everything we've ever achieved... but I do enjoy the challenge.

Fields.MenuText: I'll admit, there's something fulfilling about taking on an enemy this deadly.
At least you're in high spirits. So why does this conflict bring you excitement? Is it all just adrenaline?
Don't look at this war as if it's some large brain teaser. We're at war, Émile.

Fields.DialogueText: It forces us to come together... that, and it exercises the brain.
Adrenaline isn't what makes this enjoyable. It's that we're giving everything we have to solving a problem. I love solving problems.
Don't misunderstand, Capitaine. Just because I like using my mental faculties doesn't mean that I'm oblivious to what's at stake.
Do you think we’ll win?
Of course we will. With Belles like you, the Morganas are as good as gone.
Really? I’m happy to hear it, Capitaine.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
No Émile in the mess hall... so she must have skipped mealtime again.
There’s a light coming from my quarters... I guess she’s holed up in there. Again.
Bonjour, Capitaine. I apologize for intruding in your space, but it’s just so quiet in here. This is the perfect room for examining my Morgana scraps.

Fields.MenuText: Did you at least eat before you came in here?
Is this going to be a recurring thing?
As long as you stay fed, I don't care if you use my quarters for your work.

Fields.DialogueText: I... I was about to... I promise...
Oui, I have no intention to stop. I like working in your quarters.
Merci! I'll get some food in my stomach eventually.
I need you to eat, Émile. I can't stress it enough.
Don't worry, Capitaine. I'll eat, I promise.
The war demands that every member of the crew keeps their strength up, and you-
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
And the war makes demands on us right now, Capitaine.
How open are you to criticism, Captaine?
It depends. Is it constructive?
It will be, I assure you. I want to talk about your leadership skills.
Okay...
Now, where should I start... oh! I've noticed how laconic you get when we’re in a pinch. You need to communicate more effectively with the crew. Misunderstanding can be harmful in battle.
I've also witnessed you taking too long to make a decision, both against the enemy and onboard the ship. You're our leader, Capitaine. You must be decisive.
Émile...
Now let's talk about your lack of etiquette when dealing with the crew...

Fields.MenuText: Émile. If you're going to offer me criticism, give me time to actually process it first. You're going too fast.
Am I really that bad?
How long have you been thinking about all of this?

Fields.DialogueText: Pardonnez-moi, Capitaine. I just want this to be over with quickly. You'll feel better for it.
You're not bad... you just need improvement. Please don’t take anything I’ve said personally!
Not long. Ne vous inquiétez pas, Capitaine. You'll get better. I'll help you.
@BATTLE
You certainly made some... interesting points today, Émile.
Cheer up, Capitaine. We have incoming enemy contacts, which represent the perfect opportunity for you to improve.
Émile?
You look... unwell. Is everything okay?
I... am... overflow...

Fields.MenuText: You still haven't eaten, have you? Come with me. Right now.
We’re going to have a chat after this. Too much work and no food or rest.
I'm going to assume that the gibberish that just came out of your mouth is a plea for help. You need some grub. Let's go.

Fields.DialogueText: I am... sure... lead the way...
Oui... glad you got... it. Food.
Pardonnez-moi, Capitaine. I am sorry. I was caught up in my work.
How can you get so distracted that you forget to take care of yourself?
Eh... it just happens. I suppose I must be easier on myself from now on...
Émile, it wouldn't help anyone on board to see a passed-out Belle.
Vous avez raison... I'll get better...
@BATTLE
Get better fast - we've got enemy contact!
*ALARM*
What are you working on, Émile?
Potential improvements to the ship. I'm trying to figure out how to make my improvements work without harming anything on board.
What are some of your ideas?
Nothing too elaborate. Just repurposing some of the equipment we find after battles.
What kind of equipment?
I figured that we could scavenge some of the Morgana tech and use it to our favor.
Could we even do that? It seems like it'd take too much time...
It would take some work, but if my blueprints were followed, it could be done quickly.
Perhaps. But even then...
Do you doubt its potential?

Fields.MenuText: It's not that I doubt it, Émile. I just don't like the idea of outfitting our ships with Morgana equipment.
Do you think Morgana weapons would make that much of a difference?
Anything less expensive and time-consuming?

Fields.DialogueText: Je comprends. But think about it. They wouldn't be prepared to take on their own weapons.
Who knows? It's worth a shot. We need as much leverage as we can get. Why not do a little scavenging?
Non. I'm afraid not, Capitaine. War isn't cheap.
@BATTLE
Gather your scrap from our battles, but get my approval before you do anything.
Oui, Capitaine. Here comes an opportunity right now!
Glad to see you eating for once, Émile.
Je l'admets. A bit of a break is nice - but I can’t stop thinking about how much work I could be accomplishing...
You won't go without food as long as I'm around.
Your tray of food looks rather appealing...
It... does?
Perhaps you’d like to...
Don't do it, Émile.
... tray-ed food with me?

Fields.MenuText: You need to stop. It's not working.
Better... but that was still terrible.
You're really bent on getting me to laugh, aren't you?

Fields.DialogueText: One day, I'll get you to laugh.
At least I'm improving, Capitaine. Can’t you give me some credit?
I want to see you smile once... you always seem so gloomy.
@BATTLE
I'll have more time to laugh when the war is over.
*ALARM*
Capitaine! Vous voilà! I wanted to talk about an idea for a ship design.
I have some time. Come on in and take a seat, Émile.
Remember when we discussed my idea about using some of the Morgana scrap as weaponry?
I do. Is this along those same lines?
It's a bit more... elaborate. How would you feel about capturing a Morgana vessel?

Fields.MenuText: Dangerous. I don’t think our losses would be worth it. It's far too risky, Émile.
As much as I love that idea, I don't think I'd be around long enough to reap the rewards of doing so.
You're really into Morgana tech, aren't you?

Fields.DialogueText: It is risky. But it would be worth it. Think of the accolades...
You think that you'd be branded an insane leader and suffer a mutiny? That could happen. I didn't think of that...
Why wouldn't I be? Their technology is fascinating.
Maybe one day we’ll have the opportunity to capture a Morgana. But I don’t think we currently have the means to subdue or contain; it's hard enough wrecking them.
But we are in a war. It's worth taking a few risks, non?
That doesn't mean we should push our luck.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Working on your blueprints again?
Émile? Did you forget to eat again?
Oh. Pardon, Capitaine. I was in the middle of reading.
What is it? It looks like you're reading a newspaper.
Well, I read it for the comic strips. One in particular - a science fiction series about space exploration.

Fields.MenuText: I didn't know you were into comics.
I’m not surprised that you'd enjoy something involving space.
How long have you been reading comics?

Fields.DialogueText: Oui! Well, it's more of an interest in science fiction. But these comic strips are starting to have a larger influence on media, in general.
Space is a beautiful thing. I love reading someone's vision of what the future of our society could be like.
I didn't start until my construction was finished. It's been a few years. I think the one I'm reading right now was first published in 1928.
Maybe I'll keep an eye out for more reading material for you.
You'd do that for me? Merci, Capitaine! That would mean so much.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
That's the last of those Morganas. Another victory. We did it.
We did. Now let's...
Capitaine. May I ask for a favor? It will not endanger us, I promise.
What do you need?
You're aware of my Morgana collection. Could we swing by the debris from our last battle? I’d like a closer look.
What? I don't like the sound of that...
The debris poses no threat. It's safe, Capitaine. Mais bien sûr, we don't have to do this if you don't want to. I await your orders.

Fields.MenuText: Go ahead and do what you must, Émile. Everyone, do as she says.
I don't want to risk it. We’re not getting that close.
It doesn't matter to me, Émile. Do what you want.

Fields.DialogueText: Merci! Listen up! We're going to see what we can find.
I understand.
If that's the case, then let's find some scrap metal.
@BATTLE
Wait! We're not safe yet - more enemy contacts!
I'm curious, Capitaine... what do you think of me?
What do I think of you? Why do you ask?
I've been working rather hard lately, yet you never offer me any sort of critique.
Why would being critiqued matter that much to you?
Je ne sais pas. It just does. So, Capitaine. How am I doing?

Fields.MenuText: You're doing great, Émile. I'm glad we’re working well together.
I can't complain. You perform your duties adequately.
There's always room for improvement.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? Capitaine. I-I don't know what to say. Merci.
Just adequately? Looks as if I have some work to do!
Not what I was hoping for... but I appreciate your honesty, nonetheless.
Now I’d like to give you some critiques of my own...
*ALARM*
It looks as if that will have to wait for another time.
@BATTLE
Enemies are closing in, Captain.
Look for an opening. Do we have a safe course to avoid them?
I'm not seeing anything promising...
I believe we can take them, Capitaine.
You have an idea?
I just love a challenge. S'il vous plaît, trust me.

Fields.MenuText: I trust you, Émile.
We don’t have much of a choice, I’m afraid.
How about we put it to a vote?

Fields.DialogueText: Good. Just follow my lead.
You don’t have to sound quite so dour.
A vote? A warship is not the time or place for voting, Capitaine! We need to take action now.
Remember that confidence we spoke of? Have some in yourself, and in your Belle, oui?
Where is this going, Émile?
All right, all right. Let’s do this.
@BATTLE
Eating the same food again, Capitaine? This is the fourth time I've seen you eat that same meal. Even the placement of it on your plate is the same.
You’ve committed my meals to memory?
Bien sûr! My memory is as sharp as my wits. I can recall almost everything.

Fields.MenuText: I'm having a hard time believing that, Émile.
You know, I'm pretty good with memory as well.
Lucky guess. I bet you can't do something like that again.

Fields.DialogueText: I can tell you the entire layout of your quarters with my eyes closed. Try me.
Glad I'm not the only one.
Ensign Sanchez always sits two tables back. I rarely see him but I can tell you that, without even looking, he only has a fork and knife with him, both on the right side of the tray.
Maybe you're not lying...
I would never lie about something so silly. I could even describe every piece of Morgana scrap I've ever collected.
I don't think that'll be necessary, Émile. I believe you.
@BATTLE
You're lucky, Capitaine. I sense Morganas are approaching.
Explain to me, as we run to battle stations, how that's lucky.
Lucky because they have rescued you from that boring and repetitive food, Capitaine!
I have a gift.
So many of them, as you are fond of reminding me.
Non, Capitaine. I mean that I received a physical gift from a fellow scientist - another Belle who is just as curious about the Morganas as I am.
As curious as you? Hard to believe. So what did she send you?
A piece from a Morgana vessel. It's a perfect gift.

Fields.MenuText: Do you get these gifts often?
You keep in touch with the other Belles?
Will you examine that one in great detail? Maybe forget to eat again?

Fields.DialogueText: Not usually. I'm not the most popular Belle around, but I do have a close group of friends and mentors.
Every chance I get. I like picking a fellow Belle’s brain.
Nonsense. I'm not going to forget to eat again... hopefully...
Why are you so interested in the Morganas?
It's their technology that interests me. I want to help better the world. Some of their equipment could make progress towards that goal.
*ALARM*
Here comes another chance to better the world.
I will not permit that chance to pass me by!
@BATTLE
Capitaine, I think I have a problem...
What is it?
The other Belles don't understand me or my intentions...
But didn't you just get a gift from one of them recently?
Oui - but that was a rare exception. I'm talking about the majority of other Belles. You are aware of my critiquing ability, aren’t you?
Oh, yes. Highly aware.
Well, they misconstrue my intent. I critique them because I want them to better themselves. It's nothing personal.

Fields.MenuText: I think it's all about how you say it, Émile. Maybe try being nicer in your approach.
You're harsh - but what you have to say is usually on point.
Why bother, then? It sounds like it doesn't do you any favors.

Fields.DialogueText: That could work... I'll give it a try next time.
I know it is. But they just don’t understand.
Because they're my fellow Belles. I need to help them.
Cela me rappelle - do you have a moment for feedback on your own performance? I have a few notes...
*ALARM*
I have to go. We’ll talk later.
@BATTLE
Any luck being... friendlier in your input to the Belles?
Oui et non. I *was* friendlier, but I had no luck. In fact, I suffered an adverse effect.
What do you mean?
One of the stronger Belles started to listen to my feedback... and I crumbled...
You crumbled?
When someone's better than me, subconsciously my brain just goes to mush... it may be pressure... I’m not sure.

Fields.MenuText: Is it envy?
Do you feel that way about me?
Great effort, but it's not worth all this hassle. Focus on our own ship, not the rest of the fleet.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't think so... I just wish that I could pull myself together!
Well... maybe... now that I think about it...
I'll never give up on my Belles, Capitaine.
Concentrate on the rational side of the information you’re conveying to those Belles. Maybe that will help you to keep the emotions out of the process.
That’s not a bad idea. Merci, Capitaine!
@BATTLE
And we have more pressing matters at hand, Émile. Let's go!
*ALARM*
I got another one.
Another what?
Un autre cadeau! Another piece of Morgana scrap. I'm so thankful for them.

Fields.MenuText: Is it from the same Belle as before?
I think, deep down, the Belles know you mean well. I don't think you should worry about being too rough in your critiques.
Anything for me?

Fields.DialogueText: Oui. A fellow enthusiast in the pursuit of knowledge.
You know... maybe you're right.
For you? Non, non, non... I never mention you in my letters. I completely forget every time I write to her.
You've been gathering a lot of this junk as of late...
Not junk, Capitaine! Research.
Just don't make a mess of the ship, okay?
I promise you that I will not. Those approaching Morganas, however, will certainly try!
@BATTLE
Time for another review. Êtes-vous prêt, Capitaine?
For whatever odd reason that compels me to agree to this - yes, I am ready for a session of nitpicking everything I do.
Oh, non! Quite the opposite. Am I doing well?
Ah, we're reviewing you today. Fishing for a few compliments, are we?
Maybe... now open up. What is your opinion of me? Am I doing well in the war effort?

Fields.MenuText: You're incredible, Émile. I'm grateful that I’ve had the chance to get to know you.
You don't need to ask, Émile. It's pretty obvious how I feel about you.
Why don’t you tell me what you think about me?

Fields.DialogueText: Capitaine. You're making me blush. You're too kind.
It is? Well... I hope it's as straightforward as I think it is.
About you? I think you're the best capitaine to ever exist.
You look pale again... did you eat today?
I intended to, but...
Come on, let's go together. We need our strength to see our ship and crew through whatever comes next.
@BATTLE
That’s... much higher praise than I was expecting.
We should eat quickly, then. I sense the Morganas will be upon us before we know it...
How are the crew evaluations going, Émile?
Ça va bien - merci! Would you agree, sailor?
I just want to eat, Miss Émile.
Now, now, I promise we're nearly finished. How do you think you might improve your job performance?
I don't know... is this really necessary?
It's nothing personal. I just want to help you.
Please, just let me eat in peace. I'm hungry!
You can multitask.
Can I get some help, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: Sorry, you're on your own...
She'll go easy on you, I promise.
You can always reschedule.

Fields.DialogueText: I hope so...
What's the point? I might as well get this over with...
*ALARM*
Looks as if you’ll have to cut evaluations short for now, Émile.
Thank goodness! I am SAVED!
@BATTLE
Émile, why do you fight in the war?
Because I must. Just as you do, Capitaine.
But surely you have some other motivation, apart from simply being a member of the fleet.
Oh... je comprends. That's a pretty tough question...
I can wait...
I don't like the fighting... but technology always advances by leaps and bounds during wartime. To have the opportunity to participate in such advancement, well...
That would be a dream come true.
You really think that will happen?
Bien sûr. That's why I collect all those scraps. Maybe my blueprints will help shape the future for the better.

Fields.MenuText: You’re quite noble in your own way, Émile.
You're good at setting goals for yourself - and you tend to achieve them.
Thinking ahead is a wonderful quality, Émile.

Fields.DialogueText: So you think I will, then?
Merci, Capitaine.
@BATTLE
Noble? I do not hear that compliment often enough!
I am glad you agree.
*ALARM*
Merde! Of all the moments for the Morganas to ruin for me!
I appreciate that you always remind me to eat, Capitaine.
I still can't believe that you never remember to feed yourself. It's kind of important!
Comme je l'ai déjà dit... I get too caught up in my research.
Don't worry. I'll make sure you're taken care of.
Your concern really does mean a lot to me. Merci, Capitaine.
You haven't taken a single bite yet...
Whoops. Here, watch! Food... fork... mouth!

Fields.MenuText: You’re a bit of an odd one, you know that?
You’re a delight to look after, you know that?

Fields.DialogueText: But also, Capitaine - you eat *with* me. As I may have admitted before, I am not exactly... popular. Your company is so very appreciated.
Two plates, coming through! Here's yours, and now mine.
You are looking at me so expectantly...
That's because I'll expect you to eat this, and I'll be sitting with you the whole time to make sure you do. Somebody has to care for you, Émile.
And now, I await your critique. Did that please you, Capitaine?
